press.title: Press Kit
press.subtitle: Download logos, grab brand colors, and reference usage guidelines.

about.title: About Bonfire
about.body: {brandName} is a Czech game dev community that runs meetups in {prague} and {zlin}. Bonfire curates talks, panels, and networking nights connecting professionals, students, and indie creators. Bonfire is powered by volunteers and partners who believe in sharing craft and building a welcoming scene.

logos.title: Logo Downloads
logos.subtitle: Use the right logo for light or dark backgrounds and download in PNG or SVG.
logos.preferenceNote: We prefer the gradient versions whenever possible. If your design does not allow it, use the non-gradient logo.
logos.downloadAllSubtitle: Get every logo variant in one zip.

guidelines.title: Usage Guidelines
guidelines.subtitle: Keep the Bonfire mark clean and consistent.
guidelines.do1: Use the full logo with generous clear space around it.
guidelines.do2: Choose black or gray logos on light backgrounds and white on dark.
guidelines.do3: Keep the logo proportions and colors intact.
guidelines.dont1: Stretch, crop, rotate, or add effects to the logo.
guidelines.dont2: Place the logo on busy photography or low-contrast backgrounds.
guidelines.dont3: Recolor or rebuild the logo with different typefaces.

brandName.title: Brand Name
brandName.subtitle: Keep the name clear and consistent in editorial text.
brandName.do2: Shorten to ‚ÄúBonfire‚Äù after the first mention.
brandName.dont1: Use just ‚ÄúBonfire‚Äù as the first mention.
brandName.dont3: Add extra descriptors like ‚ÄúBonfire meetup group‚Äù.

photos.title: Event Photos
photos.body: Browse high-energy photos from our meetups.

photos.title: We Were There
photos.subtitle: A photo chronicle of Bonfire meetups, talks, and community moments.
photos.featuredSubtitle: A rotating selection from across the albums.
photos.albumsSubtitle: Browse the full archive by episode.

timeline.title: Every Bonfire Episode
timeline.subtitle: A vertical timeline of each episode with quick links to recordings and photo albums.

Check the photo album or browse other sessions.

teamPage.title: Meet the beautiful chaos crew
teamPage.subtitle: We run meetups, wrangle cables, and keep the vibes sharp in {prague} and {zlin}.
introLines: No capes. Just checklists, coffee, and a stubborn love for game dev.
If something goes right, it was planned. If something goes wrong, it was still planned.
We are allergic to boring events. We bring the spark.
teamPage.joinCallout: Want to lend a hand? Reach out at
teamPage.founderNote: Bonfire exists because of **you** - the crew, the speakers, and everyone who shows up. Building a strong community, connecting people, and sharing knowledge is what this is all about. Thank **you** for being part of it.

footer.vibes: Casual meetups, big ideas, and good vibes. üî•üéÆ
footer.copyright: ¬© {year} {brandName}. Made with love for the gamedev community.

faqPage.title: Frequently asked questions
faqPage.subtitle: Quick answers about how the site works - including meetups, community, and platform features.

whatIsBonfire.title: What is Bonfire Events?
whatIsBonfire.answer: Bonfire is a Czech game developer community that organizes regular meetups in Prague and Zl√≠n. We bring together professionals, students, and indie creators to share knowledge, network, and grow the local game dev scene.

howOften.title: How often do you host meetups?
howOften.answer: We host meetups quarterly (every 3 months) in both Prague and Zl√≠n. Check our "Upcoming" section or sign up for our newsletter to get notified about the next episode.

entryFee.title: Is there an entry fee?
entryFee.answer: All of our meetups are free to attend, thanks to our generous partners. While space is limited, registration (usually via Lu.ma) is not strictly required, but highly suggested to help us plan the seating and refreshments properly.

howToSpeaker.title: How can I become a speaker?
howToSpeaker.answer: We‚Äôre always looking for new voices! Whether it's a technical deep-dive, a post-mortem, or a short lightning talk, you can submit your idea via our <link>Propose a Talk</link> page.

howToJoin.title: How can I join the crew?
howToJoin.answer: Bonfire is powered by passionate volunteers. If you want to help with operations, photography, video, or anything else, reach out to us via the <link>contact form</link> and select "Crew" as the inquiry type.

isRecorded.title: Are all sessions recorded?
isRecorded.answer: We aim to record and share as many talks as possible in our Library. However, please note that some of our early episodes were not recorded.

discord.title: Is there a community Discord?
discord.answer: Yes! You can join our <link>Discord server</link> to chat with other game developers, share your projects, and stay updated on events.

photos.title: Can I use the event photos?
photos.answer: Our photos are shared under a community-friendly policy. You're welcome to share them on social media (we love tags!), but for commercial use, please <link>contact us first</link>.

howToSignIn.title: How do I sign in?
howToSignIn.answer: We use passwordless authentication. Simply enter your email address and we'll send you a 6-digit verification code. No need to remember or manage any passwords!

howToRegister.title: How do I register?
howToRegister.answer: There is no separate registration process. Simply sign in with your email for the first time, and we'll automatically create an account for you. It's that simple!

howToDelete.title: Can I delete my account?
howToDelete.answer: Yes, you have full control over your data. You can manually delete your account and all associated activity at any time from your <link>Account</link> page. Please note that this action is <bold>permanent and cannot be undone</bold>.

passkeyFlow.title: How do passkeys work here?
passkeyFlow.answer: First, sign in with your email to create your account. Then add a passkey in your <link>Account</link> page under Security. After that, you can use the passkey button on the login screen for faster sign-ins on supported devices.

sparks.title: What are Sparks?
sparks.body: Sparks are lightweight likes. They‚Äôre stored using a hashed IP and user-agent, so you don‚Äôt need an account. Because they‚Äôre easier to generate, they‚Äôre treated as a softer signal.
sparks.impact: Sparks increase a talk‚Äôs trending score and can help it surface in Trending Talks, especially when combined with recency.

boosts.title: What are Boosts?
boosts.body: Boosts are stronger votes from logged-in members. Each account can boost a talk once, making boosts harder to game and a better signal of committed interest.
boosts.impact: Boosts have a higher weight than Sparks in the trending score, so a few boosts can noticeably lift a talk‚Äôs visibility.
boosts.limits: Boosts are limited to 2 per month, with a maximum of 6 available at any time. Boosts you don‚Äôt use can stack up to that cap.

guild.title: What is Bonfire Guild?
guild.body: Bonfire Guild is an exclusive program currently in development that offers insiders unique behind-the-scenes access, early event content, and the opportunity to help shape the direction of our community.
guild.description: We're building something special for our most engaged members - a place where you can access exclusive content, get early previews, and have a voice in steering the future of Bonfire. Guild membership brings you closer to the heart of what we do, from backstage moments to early recording drops and special perks.
guild.features: Guild members will enjoy early access to event recordings, exclusive behind-the-scenes content, member-only Discord channels, voting rights on future talk topics, and a special badge on their profile.
guild.comingSoon: We're actively working on Guild to make it something truly worth the wait. Keep an eye on your account page for updates - your chance to join is coming soon!

legal.title: Legal & Code of Conduct
legal.subtitle: Ensuring a safe and welcoming space for all.
legal.intro: Bonfire is a community built on respect. We are dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, age, race, ethnicity, nationality, or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

scope.title: Scope
scope.content: This Code of Conduct applies to all Bonfire spaces, including our in-person meetups, online communities (Discord, social media), and any related events or gatherings. It applies to all participants, including attendees, speakers, sponsors, volunteers, and organizers.

community.title: Our Values
community.content: Our events are open to anyone interested in game development. We strive to create an inviting, friendly, and respectful environment where professionals, students, and hobbyists can connect. We encourage participants to assume good intent, be patient with newcomers, and offer constructive feedback rather than criticism. We expect all participants to be professional, considerate, and respectful of fellow attendees' boundaries and perspectives.

rules.title: Prohibited Conduct
rules.content:
The following behaviors are strictly prohibited at all Bonfire events and spaces:

<bullet><bold>Verbal Harassment</bold>: Offensive comments related to gender, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, age, race, ethnicity, nationality, or religion. This includes slurs, insults, and unwelcome comments about someone's identity or appearance.</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Physical Harassment</bold>: Unwanted physical contact, blocking someone's path, or invading personal space. Always ask before initiating physical contact such as handshakes or hugs.</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Sexual Harassment</bold>: Unwelcome sexual attention, inappropriate imagery, sexualized comments or jokes, and unwanted advances.</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Intimidation & Stalking</bold>: Threatening behavior, following someone without consent, or persistent unwanted contact both during and after events.</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Online Harassment</bold>: Harassing behavior in our Discord server, social media, or any digital communication related to Bonfire.</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Disruption</bold>: Sustained disruption of talks, presentations, or other activities.</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Privacy Violations</bold>: Recording or photographing individuals without consent, or sharing private conversations.</bullet>

consequences.title: Consequences
consequences.content:
Participants asked to stop any harassing or inappropriate behavior are expected to comply immediately. If a participant engages in prohibited conduct, event organizers may take any action they deem appropriate, including:

<bullet>A verbal warning</bullet>
<bullet>Removal from the event or online space without refund</bullet>
<bullet>A ban from future Bonfire events</bullet>
<bullet>Reporting to local authorities when applicable</bullet>

Event organizers retain sole discretion in determining the appropriate response to any situation.

photos.title: Media Policy
photos.content: We may take photos or recordings at our events for documentation and promotion. Where required by law, we will ask for your consent before using identifiable images. If you would prefer not to be photographed or recorded, please inform our staff at check-in or contact us in advance; we will make reasonable efforts to accommodate your request. If you would like a specific photo removed from our platforms, contact us and we will review the request promptly.

contact.title: Reporting & Support
contact.content: If you experience or witness a breach of this code of conduct, please report it immediately. All reports will be handled with discretion and confidentiality. You can reach our team by:
contact.methods:
<bullet>Speaking directly to any Bonfire staff member at the event (they will be clearly identifiable)</bullet>
<bullet>Emailing us (reports are monitored before, during, and after events)</bullet>
contact.closing: We take all reports seriously and are committed to addressing concerns promptly. You will not face retaliation for making a good-faith report.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: This Privacy Policy explains how the Bonfire organizing team (operating under the Bonfire Events name) collects, uses, and protects your personal information when you use our website and services.

controller.title: Data Controller
controller.content: The data controller is the Bonfire organizing team (community organizers) operating under the Bonfire Events name. We do not have a separate legal entity. If you have questions about this privacy policy, contact us at hello@bnf.events.

personal.title: Personal Data
personal.content:
We collect the following personal data:

<bullet><bold>Account Information</bold>: Email address (required for account creation)</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Newsletter Subscriptions</bold>: Email address and communication preferences if you sign up</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Form Submissions</bold>: Name, email, and message content when you submit contact forms or talk proposals</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Authentication Data</bold>: Login attempts, OTP challenges, and related metadata (including IP address and user agent) used to secure accounts</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Preferences</bold>: Email communication preferences</bullet>

technical.title: Technical Data
technical.content:
We automatically collect:

<bullet><bold>IP Addresses</bold>: Used for security and rate limiting; stored in hashed form for likes, newsletters, and forms, and stored in raw form for authentication challenges and tokens</bullet>
<bullet><bold>User Agent</bold>: Used for security and analytics; for likes and newsletters we derive a browser/OS/device signature and store a salted hash, and for authentication challenges and tokens we store the user agent string</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Usage Data</bold>: Page views, interactions, and performance metrics</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Cookies</bold>: Essential cookies for CSRF protection, locale preferences, and theme settings</bullet>

interactions.title: User Interactions
interactions.content:
We store:

<bullet><bold>Video Likes</bold>: Based on salted hashes of your IP address and a user agent signature (browser/OS/device); no account required</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Video Boosts</bold>: Linked to your user account</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Authentication Attempts</bold>: Attempts and outcomes for security purposes (may include hashed identifiers)</bullet>

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.content: We use your email address to send one-time verification codes for secure, passwordless login. Authentication data is used to verify your identity and protect your account.

communication.title: Communication
communication.content: We use your email address to respond to your inquiries, send account-related notifications, and (with your consent) send community updates about Bonfire events.

analytics.title: Analytics & Performance
analytics.content: We use aggregated or anonymized usage data where possible to understand how our website is used, improve performance, and enhance user experience.

security.title: Security
security.content: We use IP addresses, user agent strings, and login attempt data to detect and prevent abuse, spam, and unauthorized access.

legalBasis.title: Legal Basis for Processing
legalBasis.content:
We process your personal data based on:

<bullet><bold>Consent</bold>: Optional communications (e.g., community updates) and cookies where required</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Legitimate Interest</bold>: Security, fraud prevention, and basic analytics</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Contract / Pre-contract</bold>: Providing authentication, account services, and responding to your requests</bullet>

dataSharing.title: Data Sharing & Third-Party Services
dataSharing.content:
We use the following third-party services that may process your data:

<bullet><bold>Vercel</bold>: Hosting, analytics, and performance monitoring. Privacy policy: https://vercel.com/legal/privacy-policy</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Resend</bold>: Email delivery service for OTP codes and notifications. Privacy policy: https://resend.com/legal/privacy-policy</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Cloudflare Turnstile</bold>: Bot detection and spam prevention. Privacy policy: https://www.cloudflare.com/privacypolicy/</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Neon Database</bold>: Database hosting for user data and form submissions. Privacy policy: https://neon.tech/legal/privacy-policy</bullet>

We do not sell your personal data. We only share data with service providers necessary to operate our website and services.

dataStorage.title: Data Storage & Retention
dataStorage.location: Your data is stored in databases hosted by Neon. We use service providers that are required to comply with GDPR or provide appropriate safeguards.

retention.title: Retention Periods
retention.content:
We retain your data only as long as necessary for the purposes described above and to comply with legal obligations. Retention depends on the type of data and purpose. Examples include:

<bullet><bold>Account Data</bold>: While your account is active or until you request deletion</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Form Submissions</bold>: As long as needed to handle your request or proposal</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Authentication Challenges</bold>: They expire after about 10 minutes and are rejected thereafter</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Video Likes</bold>: Stored as hashed identifiers to prevent duplicate votes</bullet>

We may retain certain records longer if required by law or to establish, exercise, or defend legal claims.

yourRights.title: Your Rights (GDPR)
yourRights.content:
Under GDPR, you have the following rights:

<bullet><bold>Right to Access</bold>: You can view some account data on the /me page and request a full copy from us</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Right to Rectification</bold>: You can update some details in your account settings or ask us to correct them</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Right to Erasure</bold>: You can delete your account at any time from the /me page</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Right to Restriction</bold>: You can ask us to limit processing in certain cases</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Right to Data Portability</bold>: Contact us to request a copy of your data</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Right to Object</bold>: You can object to processing based on legitimate interests; you can opt out of community emails at any time</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Right to Withdraw Consent</bold>: You can withdraw consent for email communications at any time</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Right to Lodge a Complaint</bold>: You can lodge a complaint with the Czech Data Protection Authority (UOOU)</bullet>

To exercise these rights, contact us at hello@bnf.events or use the contact form.

cookies.title: Cookies & Tracking
cookies.content:
We use the following cookies and services:

<bullet><bold>Essential Cookies</bold>: bnf_csrf (CSRF protection), NEXT_LOCALE (language preference), bonfire-theme (theme preference)</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Analytics</bold>: Vercel Analytics collects anonymized, cookie-less usage data</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Error Reporting</bold>: Rollbar collects error data to help us fix bugs (may include page URL and browser info)</bullet>

You can manage cookies through your browser settings. Essential cookies are required for the website to function properly.

security.title: Security
security.content:
We take reasonable technical and organizational measures to protect your data. These may include:

<bullet>Passwordless authentication with time-limited OTP codes</bullet>
<bullet>Minimization of IP addresses and user agent strings (e.g., hashing) where feasible</bullet>
<bullet>HTTPS encryption for data transmission</bullet>
<bullet>Rate limiting and abuse prevention</bullet>
<bullet>Ongoing maintenance and security updates</bullet>

internationalTransfers.title: International Data Transfers
internationalTransfers.content: Your data may be processed by service providers located outside the European Economic Area (EEA). Where required, we use appropriate safeguards (such as standard contractual clauses) and assess transfers to provide an adequate level of protection.

children.title: Children's Privacy
children.content: Our services are not directed to individuals under the age of 16. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If you believe we have collected information from a child, please contact us immediately.

changes.title: Changes to This Privacy Policy
changes.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of significant changes by updating the "Last updated" date at the top of this policy. Continued use of our services after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

contactPrivacy.title: Contact Us About Privacy
contactPrivacy.content: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or wish to exercise your rights, contact us at hello@bnf.events or use our contact form.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.intro: By accessing and using the Bonfire website and services operated by the Bonfire organizing team (the "Bonfire team"), you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service.

acceptance.title: Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By creating an account, submitting forms, or using our website, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service and our Privacy Policy. If you do not agree, please do not use our services.

service.title: Description of Service
service.content: The Bonfire team provides a platform for game development community meetups, including event information, video recordings, and community features. We reserve the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue any aspect of the service at any time.

accounts.title: Account Registration
accounts.content:
To use certain features, you must create an account:

<bullet>You must provide a valid email address</bullet>
<bullet>You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account</bullet>
<bullet>You must be at least 16 years old to create an account</bullet>
<bullet>You agree to provide accurate and complete information</bullet>
<bullet>You are responsible for all activities under your account</bullet>

userConduct.title: User Conduct
userConduct.content:
You agree to:

<bullet>Use the service only for lawful purposes</bullet>
<bullet>Not attempt to gain unauthorized access to any part of the service</bullet>
<bullet>Not interfere with or disrupt the service or servers</bullet>
<bullet>Not use automated systems to access the service without permission</bullet>
<bullet>Comply with our Code of Conduct</bullet>
<bullet>Not submit false, misleading, or harmful content</bullet>

intellectualProperty.title: Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.content: The website content, including text, graphics, logos, and software, is owned by the Bonfire team or its licensors and is protected by copyright and trademark laws. You may not reproduce, distribute, or create derivative works without permission. For logo or brand usage, contact us.

userContent.title: User-Generated Content
userContent.content: By submitting content (forms, proposals, comments), you grant the Bonfire team a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use, modify, and display your content for the purpose of operating and promoting our services. You represent that you have the necessary rights and permissions to submit this content.

availability.title: Service Availability
availability.content: We strive to provide reliable service but do not guarantee uninterrupted or error-free operation. We reserve the right to perform maintenance, updates, or modifications that may temporarily affect service availability.

liability.title: Limitation of Liability
liability.content: To the maximum extent permitted by law, the Bonfire team shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising from your use of the service. Our total liability shall not exceed the amount you paid to us (if any) in the past 12 months. Nothing in these terms limits liability for intent or gross negligence, for harm to life or health, or for any liability that cannot be excluded under applicable law.

indemnification.title: Indemnification
indemnification.content: You agree to indemnify and hold harmless the Bonfire team from any claims, damages, or expenses arising from your use of the service, violation of these terms, or infringement of any rights of another party.

termination.title: Termination
termination.content: We may suspend or terminate your account at any time for violation of these terms or our Code of Conduct. You may delete your account at any time from your account settings.

governingLaw.title: Governing Law
governingLaw.content: These Terms of Service are governed by the laws of the Czech Republic. If you are a consumer, this does not affect any mandatory consumer protection rights or the right to bring claims in the courts of your place of residence.

disputes.title: Dispute Resolution
disputes.content: If you have a dispute, please contact us first at hello@bnf.events. We will attempt to resolve disputes amicably. If a resolution cannot be reached, disputes will be resolved by the courts of the Czech Republic unless mandatory consumer rules provide otherwise.

changes.title: Changes to Terms
changes.content: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. We will notify users of significant changes. Continued use of the service after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated terms.

contactTerms.title: Contact Us
contactTerms.content: If you have questions about these Terms of Service, contact us at hello@bnf.events or use our contact form.

contactPage.subtitle: Questions, feedback, partnership inquiries, or just want to say hi? Drop us a message and we'll get back to you.

form.title: Send a Message
form.subtitle: Fill out the form below and we'll respond soon.
form.name: Your Name
form.subject: Subject
form.messagePlaceholder: Tell us what's on your mind...
form.successMessage: Thanks for reaching out. We'll get back to you as soon as possible.
form.draftNote: Drafts are stored locally in your browser. If you don't submit, your data never reaches us.

errors.nameRequired: Please enter your name (at least 2 characters)
errors.emailInvalid: Please enter a valid email address
errors.subjectRequired: Please enter a subject (at least 3 characters)
errors.messageRequired: Please enter a message (at least 10 characters)
errors.rateLimited: You've sent too many messages. Please try again later.
errors.botBlocked: We couldn't verify this request. Please try again.
errors.csrfInvalid: Please refresh the page and try again.
errors.generic: Something went wrong. Please try again or email us directly.

talkProposalPage.subtitle: We're always looking for passionate speakers to share their expertise with our community. Whether you're a seasoned pro or first-time speaker, we want to hear from you.
talkProposalPage.questions: Have questions about speaking? Email us at

whatWeLookFor.title: What We Look For
whatWeLookFor.item1: Game development topics: programming, art, design, audio, production, business
whatWeLookFor.item4: Passion for sharing knowledge with the community

form.title: Submit Your Proposal
form.subtitle: Tell us about your talk idea.
form.talkTitlePlaceholder: A catchy title for your talk
form.abstractPlaceholder: Describe what your talk is about, what attendees will learn, and why it's relevant to game developers...
form.abstractHint: Minimum 50 characters. Be specific about the value for attendees.
form.experiencePlaceholder: Tell us about your background and any previous speaking experience...
form.successMessage: Thanks for your submission! We'll review your proposal and get back to you within a few weeks.
form.draftNote: Drafts are stored locally in your browser. If you don't submit, your data never reaches us.

errors.nameRequired: Please enter your name (at least 2 characters)
errors.emailInvalid: Please enter a valid email address
errors.titleRequired: Please enter a talk title (at least 5 characters)
errors.abstractRequired: Please provide an abstract (at least 50 characters)
errors.rateLimited: You've submitted too many proposals. Please try again later.
errors.botBlocked: We couldn't verify this request. Please try again.
errors.csrfInvalid: Please refresh the page and try again.
errors.generic: Something went wrong. Please try again or email us directly.

authCode.subject: Your {{brandName}} verification code
authCode.title: Verify your email
authCode.subtitle: Enter this code to complete your sign-in to {{brandName}}.
authCode.ignore: If you didn't request this code, you can safely ignore this email.
authCode.securityTip: Never share this code. {{brandName}} will never ask for it via phone, chat, or social media.

accountDelete.subject: Important: Confirm your {{brandName}} account deletion
accountDelete.title: Important: Delete your account
accountDelete.subtitle: Enter this code to permanently delete your {{brandName}} account and all associated data.
accountDelete.ignore: If you have questions or need help, contact us at hello@bnf.events
accountDelete.securityTip: Only enter this code if you requested account deletion. This action cannot be undone.

authLogin.title: Sign in to Bonfire
authLogin.subtitle: No password. Code arrives in 10 seconds.
authLogin.secureBody: We'll send a code to your email. Quick, simple, and secure.
authLogin.codeHint: Enter the 6-digit code we sent to your inbox.
authLogin.noRegistrationHint: No account? Signing in will create one automatically.
authLogin.sessionExpiredHint: Your session expired. Please log in again.
authLogin.termsPrefix: By continuing you agree to the
authLogin.termsLink: terms and acknowledge the privacy policy
authLogin.errorExpired: Code expired. Please request a new one.
authLogin.errorRateLimited: Too many attempts. Try again shortly.
authLogin.errorTooManyAttempts: Too many attempts. Request a new code.

passkey.title: Sign in with passkey
passkey.note: Passkeys work after your first email sign-in and registration in Account ‚Üí Security.
passkey.errorNotFound: No passkey found for this device.
passkey.errorFailed: Passkey authentication failed. Please try again.

account.title: Your account
account.subtitle: Keep this info handy for support.

name.label: Name
name.tooLong: Name must be 50 characters or less.
name.profanityError: Name contains inappropriate language. Please choose a different name.
name.updateError: Failed to update name. Please try again.

guild.title: Guild unlocks are coming soon.
guild.body: Backstage intel, early access drops, and bonus guild perks.

passkeys.title: Passkeys
passkeys.emptyHint: Add a passkey to sign in faster without email codes.
passkeys.errorNotAvailable: Passkeys are not available on this device.
passkeys.errorUnauthorized: Please sign in to add a passkey.
passkeys.errorRegistration: Failed to register passkey. Please try again.

boostAllocation.title: Boost Allocation
boostAllocation.limitNote: Maximum 6 boosts total. No extra boosts will be issued beyond this limit.

communityEmails.title: Community updates
communityEmails.body: Allow occasional emails about news in the Bonfire community.

publicProfile.title: Public profile
publicProfile.body: Public visibility, profile boost list, and boost mentions.

private.title: Private Profile
private.message: This profile is private and not available for viewing.

delete.title: Delete your account
delete.body: Immediate, non-recoverable deletion. You will confirm with a one-time code.
delete.intentLabel: I understand this is immediate and cannot be undone.
delete.intentRequired: Please confirm you want to delete your account immediately.
delete.sendIntro: Click send to email your confirmation code.
delete.completed: Deletion completed. Redirecting you to the homepage.
delete.error: Unable to start deletion. Please try again.
delete.expired: Code expired. Request a new one.
delete.tooManyAttempts: Too many attempts. Request a new code.

attempts.title: Recent login attempts
attempts.empty: No login attempts in the last 30 days.

support.title: Need help?
support.featureRequest: Missing a feature? Let us know!

watchLaterPage.title: Watch Later
watchLaterPage.subtitle: Your saved talks for later viewing.
watchLaterPage.empty: No videos in your Watch Later list yet.
watchLaterPage.emptyAction: Browse the library to save talks you want to watch.

checkIn.title: Event Check-in | {brandName}
checkIn.description: Show this QR at the door to check in and collect rewards.
checkIn.pageSubtitle: Present this QR code to crew

tips.title: Quick Tips
tips.brightness: Keep your screen brightness high for easy scanning
tips.manual: If needed, tap Refresh to get a new code

error.title: Couldn't load your ticket
error.description: Please try again or contact our team if the problem continues.

reader.title: Event Reader | {brandName}
reader.description: Scan QR codes for event check-in
reader.pageSubtitle: Scan QR codes to verify check-in tokens

errors.cameraAccessFailed: Failed to access camera. Please check permissions.
errors.cameraPermissionDenied: Camera permission denied. Please allow camera access in your browser settings.
errors.cameraNotFound: No camera found. Please connect a camera and try again.
errors.cameraNotReadable: Camera is in use by another application. Please close other apps using the camera.
errors.scannerContainerNotFound: Scanner container not found. Please refresh the page.
errors.accessDenied: Access denied. This page is only available to crew members.
errors.contentInvalid: QR code content is invalid or not a valid check-in token
errors.alreadyCheckedIn: User is already checked in for this event
errors.checkInFailed: Failed to check in user. Please try again.

error.title: Something went wrong
error.message: We encountered an unexpected error. Please try again.

library.title: Library Error
library.message: Failed to load the library. Please try again.

video.title: Video Error
video.message: Failed to load the video. Please try again.

api.title: API Error
api.message: Failed to load video data. Please try again.

newsletterEditor.title: Newsletter Editor
newsletterEditor.subject: Subject
newsletterEditor.previewTextPlaceholder: Brief preview shown in email clients...
newsletterEditor.previewTextHint: This appears in email previews before opening
newsletterEditor.primaryNewsHint: Main featured story with optional image and CTA button
newsletterEditor.audienceHint: Choose who will receive this newsletter
newsletterEditor.audienceAllDesc: Newsletter subscribers and registered users with allowed communication
newsletterEditor.audienceSubscribersDesc: Only users subscribed via the newsletter form
newsletterEditor.audienceRegisteredDesc: Only registered users who opted in for community emails
newsletterEditor.audienceManualDesc: Send only to manually entered email addresses
newsletterEditor.manualEmailsHint: Add extra recipients (optional for audience types, required for manual only)
newsletterEditor.sendConfirmLabel: I have reviewed the newsletter and audience and confirm I want to send to the selected recipients
newsletterEditor.sendError: Failed to send newsletter. Please try again.

attributions.title: Attributions
attributions.subtitle: Open source technologies and libraries used in this project
attributions.intro: This website is built using open source technologies. We are grateful to the developers and maintainers of these projects. Below is a list of the main technologies and their licenses.
attributions.footer: This list includes the primary dependencies. For a complete list of all packages and their licenses, please refer to the package.json file in the project repository.

cookieConsent.message: We use essential cookies for site functionality.
